questions.question_text: An administrator is preparing to deploy a VMware Cloud on AWS software-defined data center (SDDC) and is planning to scale up to 48 nodes in the future. What is the minimum size management CIDR block that is needed to meet this requirement?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Nemisis95 right again.
I would go with D (per nemisis95 info) thanks for the details.

Selected Answer: D
/20 can support up to 251
Answer is D

Selected Answer: D
https://blogs.vmware.com/cloud/2019/10/03/selecting-ip-subnets-sddc/

In single-AZ deployment, a /23 CIDR can support 27 ESXi hosts, while a /20 can support up to 251, and a /16 up to 4091, but currently limited to the SDDC maximum of 300 hosts.

D.

"requiring a total of nine hosts for capacity" - This rules out any stretched cluster option (B and C)

https://vmc.techzone.vmware.com/vmc-arch/docs/compute/vmc-aws-stretched-cluster#sec403-sub1

a stretched cluster SDDC is one in which the hosts of the SDDC are evenly split between 2 AZs within an AWS Region (with a hidden “witness” host in a 3rd AZ).

Which leaves A and D. A states "Deploy a second stand-alone cluster into the SDDC in a separate region.", you can't do this.

I think the answer is D, you cant deploy nine hosts into a stretched cluster- the number of hosts needs to be even. Also for a cloud provider outage you would want to deploy out of region. Stretched clusters cannot be deployed out of region.

comments.content: D is the only option. Stretched cluster options are ruled out since the max number of host per stretched cluster is 16 (and customer needs 9 x 2), so B doesn't work, and you can't have stretched clusters with hosts located in different regions.

discussion.content:
B
Look for the key words "without incurring undue operational overhead while adhering to a very strict project timeline". The proposed solution must have the capability to be "rapidly recovered" in the event of a cloud provider outage.
Agree with nemisis95 - D
I would go with D (per nemisis95 info) thanks for the details.
D is the correct answer as explained by nemisis95 and others below.
D is Right Choice

Answer is B 
Regional outage is highly unlikely and if protecting against regional outage the answer will be Site Recovery, no VCDR.

questions.question_text:
Due to a recent acquisition, an architect is being asked to identify and design a cloud-based solution that will assist in merging several data centers together without incurring undue operational overhead while adhering to a very strict project timeline. The proposed solution must have the capability to be rapidly recovered in the event of a cloud provider outage. After careful consideration, the architect determines that VMware Cloud on AWS would be an appropriate solution, requiring a total of nine hosts for capacity. Which additional configuration options would satisfy the requirements of this project?
A.
✑ Deploy a VMware Cloud on AWS software-defined data center (SDDC) with a single stand-alone cluster.
✑ Deploy a second stand-alone cluster into the SDDC in a separate region.
✑ Configure VMware Cloud Disaster Recovery to replicate and protect workloads to the second cluster.
B.
✑ Deploy a VMware Cloud on AWS software-defined data center (SDDC) with a single stretched cluster across two separate availability zones.
✑ Configure the cluster to ensure that all virtual machines can be restarted in the second availability zone with a near zero recovery point objective (RPO) in the event of any environment or system failures.
C.
✑ Deploy a VMware Cloud on AWS software-defined data center (SDDC) with a single stretched cluster across two separate regions.
Configure the cluster to ensure that all virtual machines can be restarted in the second region with a near zero recovery point objective (RPO) in the event
//IMG//
of any environment or system failures.
D.
✑ Deploy a VMware Cloud on AWS software-defined data center (SDDC) with a single stand-alone cluster.
✑ Deploy a second SDDC with a stand-alone cluster into a different AWS region.
✑ Configure VMware Cloud Disaster Recovery to replicate and protect workloads to the second cluster.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: DE
MellasHellas is spot on.

Selected Answer: DE
+1 for D & E
I would go with D & E per the links provided by MellasHellas

Selected Answer: DE
D and E are correct as per links listed by MellasHellas.

Selected Answer: DE
D, E - 
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Cloud-on-AWS/services/vmc-aws-manage-data-center-vms.pdf Page 42
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Cloud-on-AWS/services/com.vmware.vsphere.vmc-aws-manage-data-center-vms.doc/GUID-CCC16E07-7017-44B4-948E-A558A87BA070.html

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true for the pre-defined resource pools in VMware Cloud on AWS? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Users are allowed to monitor and modify the resource allocation settings in the Mgmt-RsourcePool.
choices.B: The Mgmt-ResourcePool is able to utilize resources in subsequently created clusters if needed.
choices.C: Users can modify the pre-configured vSphere DRS settings in their own Compute-ResourcePool.
choices.D: Users can rename child resource pools to better match company policy.
choices.E: All workload virtual machines are created in the top-level (root) Compute-ResourcePool by default.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
In AWS, when you want to redirect S3 traffic, Endpoints are used, in this way the traffic does not leave the AWS site through the Internet and the traffic is processed locally, this is a typical use with backup solutions .

Selected Answer: C
Once again, C

Selected Answer: C
Correct is C as the traffic will leave SDDC to connect VPC via the ENI and then to the S3 via endpoint.
I agree with C

Selected Answer: C
when you want to redirect S3 traffic Endpoints are use
I agree with .C
C. Create a gateway endpoint in the linked AWS VPC and configure it for use with the S3 bucket.

questions.question_text:
An administrator deploys a virtual machine and configures it to perform backups to an AWS Simple Storage Service (S3) bucket. After the first month of use, the administrator receives a bill from AWS indicating egress charges were applied to the backup traffic leaving the software-defined data center (SDCC), destined for the AWS S3 bucket. What can the administrator do to ensure backup traffic travels to the linked Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) through the Elastic Network
Interface?

choices.A: Configure the S3 bucket with a public endpoint accessible over the Internet through HTTPS.
choices.D: Configure a route-based virtual private network (VPN) for the SDDC to the VPC.
choices.C: Create a gateway endpoint in the linked AWS VPC and configure it for use with the S3 bucket.
choices.B: Configure Direct Connect to a private virtual interface for access to AWS services.

questions.question_text: What is a key functionality of the vRealize Automation Cloud Service Broker?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The only choice.
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
A is correct.
From the VMC on AWQS training,
"Service Broker aggregates services from multiple sources into a single catalog that you provide to your users. Users use this catalog to request the offered services."

choices.D: Creates and deploys virtual machines, applications, and services to multiple clouds.
choices.A: Provides a common catalog for easy consumption on VMware Cloud.
choices.B: Manages blueprints as a code in a YAML format.
